Package sw

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    DirectoryCrawler
    A directory crawler.
    DistributedSW
    A distributed version of the Smith-Waterman genetic alignment algorithm.
    DistributedSW.AlignmentScore
    Calculates and returns the score for an alignment of base pairs.
    May be a match or a mismatch of base pairs.
    DistributedSW.Broadcast
    The 'reduce' function for matrix scoring.
    Broacasts the cell scores for each cell in the current list of cells to the specified children and grandchildren cells.
    DistributedSW.CellResultComp
    A Comparator of cell results from the map phase when filling the matrices.
    This orders cells in ascending order of their j coordinate values.
    DistributedSW.DeepCopyTuple
    Returns a deep copy of the given Tuple2<int[][],char[][]>.
    DistributedSW.GetAlignments
    Step 2 of the Smith-Waterman algorithm.
    Backtracks through the matrix from cells with the maximum cell score to obtain optimal alignments.
    This step is distributed.
    Returns an ArrayList of all optimal alignments and the index of their alignment locations.
    DistributedSW.GetBases
    Extracts and returns the base pairs corresponding to the i and j indices of a cell in the scoring matrix, in the order {reference,read}.
    DistributedSW.GetCellScore
    The map function for matrix scoring.
    DistributedSW.GetInitList
    Returns the next, incomplete, diagonal grandchildren row of the matrix as an ArrayList, or null if it does not exist.
    DistributedSW.GetMatchSite
    The map function for extracting optimal alignments.
    This extracts and returns the optimal alignment (match location) of the read to the reference sequence.
    DistributedSW.GetNextStart
    Returns the (i,j) coordinates of the first cell of the next grandchildren row.
    The first cell in the row is defined as the cell with the smallest j value.
    DistributedSW.InsDelScore
    Calculates and returns the insertion or deletion score of a cell.
    Both scores are calculated in the same way.
    DistributedSW.MatchSiteComp
    A Comparator of matching sites.
    This orders elements in ascending order of the indices of the alignment.
    DistributedSW.OptAlignments
    Finds the best-match reference sequence(s) to the given read using a distributed version of the Smith-Waterman algorithm.
    Returns the alignment score and the optimal alignments.
    DistributedSW.ScoreMatrix
    Step 1 of the Smith-Waterman algorithm.
    Distribution
    Runs the Smith-Waterman genetic alignment algorithm with different distribution methods.
    Distribution.CombineReadsToRef
    A function used for combining arguments required for the map function when distributing reference sequences.
    Distribution.DistributeAlgorithm
    Finds the best-aligned reference to each of the input sequences in the input directory.
    This uses a distributed version of the Smith-Waterman genetic alignment algorithm.
    Distribution.DistributeReference
    Finds the best-aligned reference to each of the input sequences in the input directory.
    This distributes the dataset of reference sequences.
    Distribution.MapRef
    This function is run when the dataset of reference sequences is mapped.
    This uses the non-distributed version of the Smith-Waterman algorithm.
    Distribution.MatchSiteComp
    A Comparator of matching sites.
    This orders elements in ascending order of the indices of the alignment.
    Distribution.NoDistribution
    Control.
    Distribution.OptSeqsComp
    A Comparator of optimal sequences.
    This orders elements in ascending order of the metadata of the reference sequences.
    InOutOps
    Class of functions dealing with input and ouput, restricted to: reading from and writing to files formatting data into a String for printing printing data to standard out
    Written in functional Spark.
    InOutOps.GetOutputStr
    Generates and returns a formatted String of the given information.
    InOutOps.GetReads
    Extracts all reads from an input file and returns them, in order, in an ArrayList.
    InOutOps.GetRefSeqs
    Extracts each reference sequence from a file of reference sequences and returns them, in order, in an ArrayList{String[]}, where each element has the form { metadata , sequence }.
    InOutOps.IsMetadata
    Returns true if the given line is a line of metadata, false otherwise.
    InOutOps.PrintMatrices
    Returns a formatted String of the matrices of scores and corresponding alignment types generated in the first step of the Smith-Waterman algorithm.
    Also prints this String to standard out.
    InOutOps.PrintStrToFile
    Prints the given String to the file with the given file path.
    The directory in which the file is to reside in must exist.
    SmithWaterman
    The Smith-Waterman genetic alignment algorithm.
    SmithWaterman.AlignmentScore
    Calculates and returns the score for an alignment of base pairs.
    May be a match or a mismatch of base pairs.
    SmithWaterman.GetAlignment
    Step 2 of the Smith-Waterman algorithm.
    Given a starting cell, backtracks through the matrix to obtain an optimal alignment.
    SmithWaterman.GetCellScore
    Returns the cell score and alignment type in a Tuple2 for a given cell.
    SmithWaterman.InsDelScore
    Calculates and returns the insertion or deletion score of a cell.
    Both scores are calculated in the same way.
    SmithWaterman.OptAlignments
    Finds the best-match reference sequence(s) to the given read, using the Smith-Waterman algorithm.
    Returns the alignment score and the optimal alignments.
    SmithWaterman.ScoreMatrix
    Step 1 of the Smith-Waterman algorithm.
